description: Master-planned resort area with high-end hotels, Whalers Village, and golf courses.
Luxury resort community known for its golf courses, bays, and wind protection.
Low-rise resort bay area with a classic old-Hawaii feel and excellent snorkeling.
The historic heart of West Maui, formerly the royal capital.
Upscale resort district with luxury shopping, manicured beaches, and golf.
The dense tourist center of Kihei with shops, bars, and surf schools (The Cove).
Windy stretch of coastline with long beaches (Sugar Beach) and condos.
Rugged, less developed southern coastline with lava fields and Big Beach.
The walkable commercial core of Paia with boutiques and Mana Foods.
Small residential enclave just past Paia town, home to Mama's Fish House.
Agricultural cliffside area home to the famous "Jaws" surf break.
Windy harbor village known for the ocean center and boat tour departures.
Lush, stream-cut valley featuring the iconic Iao Needle.
Remote district past Hana, part of HaleakalƒÅ National Park (Oheo Gulch).
Central Kula area with botanical gardens and farm stands.
